statement.tex: \text{Solve this Linear Programming problem}\\ \text{graphically. Maximise } Z=-x+2y \text{ subject}\\ \text{to the constraints } x \ge 3,\, x+y \ge 5\\ x+2y\ge 6\, y \ge 0 \text{Does this plot correctly represent the } \\ \text{feasible region given the constraints?} \text{What is the value of the maximum} \\ \text{for the corner points as seen in the graph?} \text{Does this represent the open half plane}\\ -x+2y\gt 1\text{ that will help determine if a}\\ \text{maximum is possible?}

reason.tex: x+y\ge 5\implies y\ge -x+5\text{ (area above)}\\ x+2y\ge 6\implies y\ge -x/2+3\text{ (area above)}

options.tex: \begin{align} \text{Corner Points}\qquad &Z=-x+2y \\ (3, 2) \qquad &1 \\ (4, 1) \qquad &-2 \\ (6, 0) \qquad &-6 \end{align}\\ \text{cannot predict maximum based on}\\ \text{this information.}
